body.p: To His Excellency Thos. E. Bramlette Governor of Kentucky
Your Petitioner James Bohannon respectfully represent that on the 2 day of February 1863 he was fined fifty Dollars in the Police Court of Frankfort upon a charge of breach of the peace

He States that on the first day of Feby (as the day before the trial) In is as required by Military Authority or Shelby County Ky to guard certain prisoners to Frankfort and that in obedience to the order he came with Said prisoners to Said City. That after he had discharged the duty he drank spiritous liquor to a greater extent than he ought to have done and without having any enmity toward the person at whose bar he drank he quarreled with Said person and having been ^previously^ furnished a pistol by the officer in Shelby County who required him to act as guard he pulled out the pistol having no intention to shoot with it whatever; and Some disturbance was created although no one was inferred. Your Petitioner is unable to pay the fine and will State that he regrets extremely that he suffered himself to be guilty of Said Conduct
He prays for a remission of the fine fees and costs assessed.
We concur in the prayer of the Petitioner
I certify that I was the prosecuting atto on the part of the City in this case and I think that it is a case that warrants the interposition of Executive Clemency. all the facts considered.

Very Respectfully
W. H. Sneed atto
Pro tem

John C. Boline
J. L. McGrivies
